title: [Question] Query regarding multi-threading, threadlock, concurrent futures inside mlflow?
body:
I've seen usage of `threading.lock()` api -
1. https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/0fa849ad75e5733bf76cc14a4455657c5c32f107/mlflow/store/tracking/sqlalchemy_store.py#L89
2. https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/4195541c7f6a79fba4ccad2295534f16eaa8db39/mlflow/_spark_autologging.py#L28

On searching for threading use cases - https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/search?p=1&q=threading , it seems to be used in a few tests, some Kubernetes usage - https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/7a2e079b546644defba5bed35b5a8baa97693050/mlflow/projects/kubernetes.py#L109 and a threadpool usage in code related to TensorFlow - https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/0fa849ad75e5733bf76cc14a4455657c5c32f107/mlflow/tensorflow/__init__.py#L73

Now coming back to my queries, would it be safe to assume -
1. MLFlow uses multi-threading?
2. If we're contributing to or using MLFlow OSS code, which parts should we be cautious of concurrency-related issues? Maybe Database? Logging? Flask-server?
3. Multi-processing wasn't used for certain specific reasons?
